events.message: The policyholder reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at a busy intersection, resulting in significant damage.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords including collision and vehicle damage from the description.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to the policyholder’s file to assist with next steps efficiently.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the policyholder that the review would begin shortly.
Request sent to the claimant for photos of vehicle damage, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license for verification.
The policyholder submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos and the official police accident report promptly.
Investigation into the accident circumstances commenced, focusing on damage assessment and liability determination.
Investigation concluded with findings that the claimant was not at fault and damage was consistent with reported events.
A settlement offer covering repair costs and rental car reimbursement was proposed to the claimant for review.
The policyholder responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the communication and resolution proposal.
The claim was formally approved following agreement on the settlement amount by the customer and insurer.
Payment for the approved claim was issued electronically to the customer’s bank account to cover repair expenses.
The claim file has been officially closed after successful payment and confirmation of vehicle repair completion.
